combatOverview.title: Combat Basics
combatOverview.description: Combat is how creatures deal damage to opponents and each other. It's the primary way to reduce an opponent's life total and win the game.
combatOverview.importance: Understanding combat timing and interactions is crucial for both attacking successfully and defending effectively.
combatOverview.keyPrinciple: Combat happens in structured steps that allow both players to make decisions and cast spells.

beginningOfCombat.name: Beginning of Combat Step
beginningOfCombat.description: The first step of the combat phase where combat begins.
whatHappens: Triggered abilities that happen 'at the beginning of combat' trigger
Players can cast spells and activate abilities
This is the last chance to act before attackers are declared
strategicNotes: Remove creatures before they can attack
Cast pump spells that last 'until end of turn'
Activate abilities that prepare for combat
commonActions: Cast removal spells on potential attackers

declareAttackers.name: Declare Attackers Step
declareAttackers.description: The active player chooses which creatures attack and what they attack.
whatHappens: Attacking creatures become tapped (unless they have vigilance)
Choose what each attacker is attacking (player or planeswalker)
Abilities that trigger when creatures attack trigger
rules: Creatures with summoning sickness can't attack
Must declare all attackers at once
strategicNotes: Consider what the opponent can block
Think about which creatures you need for defence
Attacking planeswalkers can be strategically important

declareBlockers.name: Declare Blockers Step
declareBlockers.description: The defending player chooses which creatures block attacking creatures.
whatHappens: Each blocker can block exactly one attacker
Multiple creatures can block the same attacker
Abilities that trigger when creatures block trigger
rules: Creatures can only block if they're untapped
Flying creatures can only be blocked by flying or reach
Must declare all blockers at once
Blocked creatures remain blocked even if blocker is removed
strategicNotes: Consider the value trade of your creatures
Sometimes taking damage is better than losing creatures
Multiple blockers can take down large threats

combatDamage.name: Combat Damage Step
combatDamage.description: Creatures deal damage to what they're fighting.
whatHappens: All combat damage is assigned and dealt simultaneously
Creatures deal damage equal to their power
Unblocked attackers damage the defending player or planeswalker
Creatures with lethal damage are destroyed
damageAssignment: Attacking creature deals damage to blocking creature(s)
Blocking creature deals damage to attacking creature
Unblocked attackers damage the defending player
Trample damage spills over to the defending player
specialRules: First strike creates an additional combat damage step
Double strike deals damage in both first strike and regular steps
Deathtouch makes any amount of damage lethal
Lifelink causes damage dealt to gain that much life

endOfCombat.name: End of Combat Step
whatHappens: Abilities that trigger 'at end of combat' trigger
Players can cast spells and activate abilities
cleanup: Creatures stop being attacking and blocking
Combat damage wears off at end of turn

attackingKeywords.haste: Can attack the turn it enters the battlefield
attackingKeywords.flying: Can only be blocked by creatures with flying or reach
attackingKeywords.trample: Excess damage goes to defending player
attackingKeywords.menace: Can only be blocked by two or more creatures
attackingKeywords.intimidate: Can only be blocked by artifact creatures or creatures that share a colour

blockingKeywords.defender: Cannot attack but often has good blocking stats
blockingKeywords.vigilance: Can block after attacking (if it attacked)
blockingKeywords.flash: Can be cast during combat to surprise block

damageKeywords.firstStrike: Deals combat damage before normal damage
damageKeywords.doubleStrike: Deals first strike and normal combat damage
damageKeywords.deathtouch: Any amount of damage is lethal
damageKeywords.lifelink: Damage dealt gains you that much life
damageKeywords.infect: Deals poison counters to players, -1/-1 counters to creatures

whenToAttack: When you can deal meaningful damage
When the opponent can't block effectively
To force the opponent to make difficult decisions
When you have combat tricks to protect attackers
considerations: What can the opponent block with?
Do you need creatures for defence?

whenNotToBlock: When the opponent likely has tricks
When you need creatures for your own attack

combatTricks.timing: Usually cast after blockers are declared but before damage
combatTricks.strategy: Force bad trades or save your creatures

commonMistakes: Attacking with creatures you need for defence
Blocking when you should take the damage
Poor damage assignment with multiple blockers

damageCalculation.basic: Power determines damage dealt, toughness determines damage needed to destroy
damageCalculation.trading: Creatures with equal power and toughness destroy each other
damageCalculation.trample: Assign lethal damage to blockers, excess goes to defending player
damageCalculation.multipleBlockers: Attacking player chooses damage assignment order

examples.result: Both creatures die (each takes lethal damage)
Blocker dies, 2 damage to defending player
Attacker assigns damage: could kill both 1/1s or kill one and survive

practicalTips: Always consider what instant spells your opponent might have
Count damage carefully before making blocking decisions
Remember that creatures heal at end of turn
Use combat to force opponents to make difficult choices
Don't forget about planeswalkers as attack targets
Sometimes the threat of attacking is as powerful as actually attacking
Learn to recognise when you're the aggressor vs. the defender
Combat tricks are most effective when unexpected
